image.title: STEMHub Foundation | Empowerment Through STEM Education Blog

item.title: How to Make Your Wedding Reception Fun
item.description:
Following all the conventionalities, there are only two things your wedding guests look forward to: Food and a good party! This is why a fun filled wedding reception can never be over emphasized.

Photo by Marius Tudor

item.title: I want a wedding too. Plis dear.
item.description:
I have dreamt of my wedding since I was a little boy. One morning, when I was 4 years old, I woke up to get ready for school and I told my mum about the dream I had the night before. I was so excited because the dream was very elaborate. It was a dream of my wedding.

My 4-year old mind left no stone unturned in imagining the grandest of weddings. It was not a traditional wedding and thinking back, it must have been influenced by the movies I watched around the time. I wore a black tuxedo with a pristine white shirt and a tie (I can’t remember the colour or style anymore lol). No detail was spared as I also dreamed of the music that was played as my bride walked down the aisle to me.

item.title: Never fall for a Yoruba Demon again. Use the Yoruba Demon Detector
item.description:
Ladies! Queens! The scope has changed, be aware, be very aware!

Photo by Jeremy Bishop on Unsplash

Most young Nigerian adults in this generation must be aware of the popular term ‘Yoruba Demon’; coined to ostensibly discredit but however celebrates the young, charismatic, well-off men from the South-Western part of Nigeria who have made it their pre-occupations to break the hearts of young ladies, thereby facilitating sad love stories, irresistible gossip and blog/thread content.

item.title: Wedding Planning is stressful. Make it Fulfilling with Lush Plans
item.description:
Photo by Tessa Rampersad on Unsplash

With planning a Nigerian wedding or any wedding at all, there’ll always be more things to do even when you think you have done the most. Planning a wedding involves putting so many ideas together. These ideas entail: a venue, event planner, caterer, DJ, photographer and so on. The individuals or groups that provide these services are what most people refer to as vendors. Well, specifically, wedding vendors.

item.title: Planning to Plan My Wedding
item.description:
(Incubating Ideas and Tips)

www.memphite.com

Planning a wedding has got to be one of the biggest and scariest responsibilities to take on, right? I mean it’s like babysitting hundreds or thousands of adults for a few hours on the most important day of your life!

item.title: We studied Nigerian weddings & were shocked
item.description:
We wanted to understand the Nigerian Wedding Industry and people’s experience so we did a huge survey. Ultimately, we wanted the survey to inform our decision as to develop a platform for making the stressful process of wedding planning fulfilling.

The Wedding Survey by Lush Plans

item.title: We failed at starting a Business and it was depressing
item.description: Nigerians spend millions on a wedding. The industry is huge! Nigeria and Nigerians love to party & have fun. The wedding industry in one of the fastest growing industries in Nigeria. In a typical Nigerian wedding, people can attend without an invite and it is often hard to manage attendees. Additionally, inviting and tracking guests can be a challenge because most invitations are delivered, by hand, by the couple or their family members. An Instagram user on the Bella Naija Weddings Instagram said it is “… it is extremely hard to keep up with everything”.
